title: Aptiv Reports Higher Revenue, 3Q Profit
text:
By Patrick Thomas

Aptiv PLC (APTV) said its third-quarter profit rose as revenue increased about 2% from a year earlier.

The auto parts company reported a profit of $246 million, or 96 cents a share, compared with $222 million, or 84 cents a share, a year ago.

The company reported adjusted earnings of $1.27 a share. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of $1.21 a share, or $1.27 a share on an adjusted basis.

Revenue rose to $3.56 billion from $3.49 billion a year earlier. Analysts had expected $3.61 billion of revenue in the quarter. The company said the strike at General Motors Co.'s (GM) U.S. factories cost it about $70 million in revenue for the quarter.

Write to Patrick Thomas at patrick.thomas@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 30, 2019 07:09 ET (11:09 GMT)
